title: I Want a Rich-Looking Wardrobe—33 Perfect Picks From Nordstrom's (Early) Black Friday Sale
description: Get a jump start with these chic gems.
excerpt: These 33 chic fashion deals from the Nordstrom Black Friday Sale have this editor's attention. Think elegant outerwear, chic sweaters, cool jeans, elevated basics, sleek shoes, and more.
text: Surprise! The Nordstrom Black Friday Sale has officially started. As someone who likes to shop for gifts early, I can't tell you how excited I am about the timing here. It's perfect for getting a jump start on holiday shopping, not only for your friends and loved ones but as a well-deserved treat for yourself as well. My own closet was top of mind when I first scoured the sale offerings, which are up to 50% off. By the looks of my virtual cart, I was quite pleased at the array of chic gems I came across.One goal I had in mind during this deep dive was to keep an eye out for rich-looking pieces to add to my wardrobe. Think elegant outerwear, chic sweaters, cool jeans, elevated basics, sleek shoes, and so much more. Each piece is effortless and timeless all at once and can be worn for many seasons to come. Did I mention that over half of my top picks are under $100?Keep scrolling to shop 33 incredibly chic and expensive-looking pieces straight from Nordstrom's early Black Friday Sale. Good American Oversize Suiting Blazer Black blazers never disappoint. Favorite Daughter The Low Favorite Pants Loving this modern trouser style. Nordstrom Arazio Kitten Heel Bootie The perfect black bootie. Bernardo Double Breasted Belted Coat Teddy Blake Lola Stampatto 12" Brown bags are having a moment. Madewell The '90s High Waist Straight Leg Jeans Madewell denim is a no-brainer. ASTR the Label Square Neck Midi Dress A little black dress worth scooping up. CeCe Cotton Blend Polo Sweater Polo sweaters have my attention. BP. Lace Trim Satin Miniskirt This mini has major cool vibes. Kenneth Cole Jasmine Mary Jane Flat Great with everything from dresses to jeans. ELOQUII Faux Leather Longline Blazer Obsessed with the longer cut of this blazer. & Other Stories Satin Midi Skirt A black skirt you'll wear forever. rag & bone Belize Leather Shopper Bag Burgundy feels spot-on for fall and winter. Halogen Sequin V-Neck Sleeveless Sweater This has a festive feel thanks to the sequins. Madewell The Curvy '90s Straight Crop Jeans I told you Madewell jeans are standouts. Sam Edelman Loraine Bit Loafer A perfect way to add a touch of leopard-print to your look. Lucky Brand Oversize Double Breasted Coat Camel coats make every outfit look more expensive. Madewell Pintuck Slim Pull-On Pants These are great for dressing up or down. Madewell Romy Shrunken Sweater Vest This whole look is a winner. Reiss Mina Pointed Toe Chelsea Boot Here for the sculptural heel. Nordstrom Strapless A-Line Dress Tell me this whole ensemble doesn't scream wealth. Anne Klein Collarless Tweed Blazer Nocturne High Waisted Wide Leg Jeans Nordstrom Stripe Long Sleeve Cotton Sweater I want to live in this striped sweater. Sam Edelman Bianka Slingback Pump Slingback heels make any outfit look sophisticated. Via Spiga Water Resistant Cotton Blend Trench Coat A classic trench worth considering. Reformation Cynthia High Waist Straight Leg Jeans Reformation denim is an editor favorite. ELOQUII Portrait Collar Rib Cardigan Burgundy and off-the-shoulder? Say less. MELLODAY Floral Print Ruched Satin Midi Dress Love this for a fall or winter wedding. Teddy Blake Nina Croco 12" Croc-embossed bags are a personal favorite. Good American Luxe Suiting Boyfriend Blazer Navy pieces should not be overlooked. DL1961 Drue Straight Leg Jeans Can you tell I love straight-leg jeans? Jeffrey Campbell Lurie Fisherman Shoe I can totally see the Olsen twins wearing these. Jennifer Camp Forbes is currently an editor at Who What Wear, where she has worked in a variety of capacities for over a decade, including creative director and various editor roles. She’s well-known as a shopping expert that’s sought out for advice and insight on the latest trends, outfit ideas, and fashion picks thanks to her thoughtful shopping roundups, digital moodboards, and extensive knowledge of up-and-coming brands, plus the new arrivals sections of the chicest retailers. Jennifer has had a lifelong interest in fashion which led her to intern at Harper’s Bazaar as an undergraduate. Later, while working towards her masters degree in psychological counseling at Columbia University, she founded two digital fashion publications: Le Fashion and Olsens Anonymous. The popularity of both sites grew and after graduation she decided put her plans to become a therapist aside to pursue a career in fashion. While she has called Los Angeles and New York City home in the past, she currently works remotely from Massachusetts. When she’s not obsessing over and writing about her latest fashion finds, she is delighting in raising two little ones with her highschool sweetheart, perusing TikTok religiously, listening to podcasts and audiobooks, creating abstract photographs, and eating the best Mexican food she can get her hands on.
html:
Surprise! The Nordstrom Black Friday Sale has officially started. As someone who likes to shop for gifts early, I can't tell you how excited I am about the timing here. It's perfect for getting a jump start on holiday shopping, not only for your friends and loved ones but as a well-deserved treat for yourself as well. My own closet was top of mind when I first scoured the sale offerings, which are up to 50% off. By the looks of my virtual cart, I was quite pleased at the array of chic gems I came across.

One goal I had in mind during this deep dive was to keep an eye out for rich-looking pieces to add to my wardrobe. Think elegant outerwear, chic sweaters, cool jeans, elevated basics, sleek shoes, and so much more. Each piece is effortless and timeless all at once and can be worn for many seasons to come. Did I mention that over half of my top picks are under $100?

Keep scrolling to shop 33 incredibly chic and expensive-looking pieces straight from Nordstrom's early Black Friday Sale.

Good American

Oversize Suiting Blazer

Black blazers never disappoint.

Favorite Daughter

The Low Favorite Pants

Loving this modern trouser style.

Nordstrom

Arazio Kitten Heel Bootie

The perfect black bootie.

Double Breasted Belted Coat

Teddy Blake

Lola Stampatto 12"

Brown bags are having a moment.

Madewell

The '90s High Waist Straight Leg Jeans

Madewell denim is a no-brainer.

Square Neck Midi Dress

A little black dress worth scooping up.

Polo sweaters have my attention.

BP.

Lace Trim Satin Miniskirt

This mini has major cool vibes.

Jasmine Mary Jane Flat

Great with everything from dresses to jeans.

ELOQUII

Obsessed with the longer cut of this blazer.

& Other Stories

A black skirt you'll wear forever.

I told you Madewell jeans are standouts.

Teddy Blake

Croc-embossed bags are a personal favorite.

Luxe Suiting Boyfriend Blazer

Navy pieces should not be overlooked.

DL1961

Drue Straight Leg Jeans

Can you tell I love straight-leg jeans?

Jeffrey Campbell

Lurie Fisherman Shoe

I can totally see the Olsen twins wearing these.

Jennifer Camp Forbes is currently an editor at Who What Wear, where she has worked in a variety of capacities for over a decade, including creative director and various editor roles. She’s well-known as a shopping expert that’s sought out for advice and insight on the latest trends, outfit ideas, and fashion picks thanks to her thoughtful shopping roundups, digital moodboards, and extensive knowledge of up-and-coming brands, plus the new arrivals sections of the chicest retailers. Jennifer has had a lifelong interest in fashion which led her to intern at Harper’s Bazaar as an undergraduate. Later, while working towards her masters degree in psychological counseling at Columbia University, she founded two digital fashion publications: Le Fashion and Olsens Anonymous. The popularity of both sites grew and after graduation she decided put her plans to become a therapist aside to pursue a career in fashion. While she has called Los Angeles and New York City home in the past, she currently works remotely from Massachusetts. When she’s not obsessing over and writing about her latest fashion finds, she is delighting in raising two little ones with her highschool sweetheart, perusing TikTok religiously, listening to podcasts and audiobooks, creating abstract photographs, and eating the best Mexican food she can get her hands on.
